channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Re4: Learning to Re-contrast, Re-attend, Re-construct for Multi-interest Recommendation
item.description: Specifically, Re4 encapsulates three backward flows, i. e., 1) Re-contrast, which drives each interest embedding to be distinct from other interests using contrastive learning; 2) Re-attend, which ensures the interest-item correlation estimation in the forward flow to be consistent with the criterion used in final recommendation; and 3) Re-construct, which ensures that each interest embedding can semantically reflect the information of representative items that relate to the corresponding interest.

item.title: Brain Topography Adaptive Network for Satisfaction Modeling in Interactive Information Access System
item.description: We explore the effectiveness of BTA for satisfaction modeling in two popular information access scenarios, i. e., search and recommendation.

item.title: Paint2Pix: Interactive Painting based Progressive Image Synthesis and Editing
item.description: In particular, we propose a novel approach paint2pix, which learns to predict (and adapt) "what a user wants to draw" from rudimentary brushstroke inputs, by learning a mapping from the manifold of incomplete human paintings to their realistic renderings.

item.title: The Conversational Short-phrase Speaker Diarization (CSSD) Task: Dataset, Evaluation Metric and Baselines
item.description: In the metric aspect, we design the new conversational DER (CDER) evaluation metric, which calculates the SD accuracy at the utterance level.

item.title: Extreme-scale Talking-Face Video Upsampling with Audio-Visual Priors
item.description: We show that when we process this $8\times8$ video with the right set of audio and image priors, we can obtain a full-length, $256\times256$ video.

item.title: Semi-supervised Learning with Deterministic Labeling and Large Margin Projection
item.description: The centrality and diversity of the labeled data are very influential to the performance of semi-supervised learning (SSL), but most SSL models select the labeled data randomly.

item.title: Two Heads are Better than One: Robust Learning Meets Multi-branch Models
item.description: Compared to all methods that do not use additional data for training, our models achieve 67. 3% and 41. 5% robust accuracy on CIFAR-10 and CIFAR-100 (improving upon the state-of-the-art by +7. 23% and +9. 07%).

item.title: Deep Learning Enabled Time-Lapse 3D Cell Analysis
item.description: This paper presents a method for time-lapse 3D cell analysis.

item.title: MoCapDeform: Monocular 3D Human Motion Capture in Deformable Scenes
item.description: 3D human motion capture from monocular RGB images respecting interactions of a subject with complex and possibly deformable environments is a very challenging, ill-posed and under-explored problem.

item.title: Video-TransUNet: Temporally Blended Vision Transformer for CT VFSS Instance Segmentation
item.description: Our findings suggest that the proposed model can indeed enhance the TransUNet architecture via exploiting temporal information and improving segmentation performance by a significant margin.

item.title: A Hybrid SFANC-FxNLMS Algorithm for Active Noise Control based on Deep Learning
item.description: Owing to the effective combination of the two algorithms, experimental results show that the hybrid SFANC-FxNLMS algorithm can achieve a rapid response time, a low noise reduction error, and a high degree of robustness.

item.title: Auto-segmentation of Hip Joints using MultiPlanar UNet with Transfer learning
item.description: Accurate geometry representation is essential in developing finite element models.

item.title: Multimodal foundation models are better simulators of the human brain
item.description: Further, from the perspective of neural encoding (based on our foundation model), we find that both visual and lingual encoders trained multimodally are more brain-like compared with unimodal ones.

item.title: Deep Learning-Based Discrete Calibrated Survival Prediction
item.description: Deep neural networks for survival prediction outper-form classical approaches in discrimination, which is the ordering of patients according to their time-of-event.

item.title: Which Factors Drive Open Access Publishing? A Springer Nature Case Study
item.description: Employing statistical methods, we describe the relationship between authors affiliated with countries from different income levels, their choice of publishing (OA or closed access), and the citation impact of their papers.

item.title: FCN-Transformer Feature Fusion for Polyp Segmentation
item.description: The resulting features from both branches are then fused for final prediction of a $h\times w$ segmentation map.

item.title: A Survey on Incomplete Multi-view Clustering
item.description: However, in practical applications, such as disease diagnosis, multimedia analysis, and recommendation system, it is common to observe that not all views of samples are available in many cases, which leads to the failure of the conventional multi-view clustering methods.

item.title: A Scalable and Extensible Approach to Benchmarking NL2Code for 18 Programming Languages
item.description: We describe a general approach for easily adding support for new benchmarks and languages to MultiPL-E.

item.title: Incremental 3D Scene Completion for Safe and Efficient Exploration Mapping and Planning
item.description: We further present an informative path planning method, leveraging the capabilities of our mapping approach and a novel scene-completion-aware information gain.

item.title: Position-aware Structure Learning for Graph Topology-imbalance by Relieving Under-reaching and Over-squashing
item.description: Topology-imbalance is a graph-specific imbalance problem caused by the uneven topology positions of labeled nodes, which significantly damages the performance of GNNs.

item.title: Transformer Encoder for Social Science
item.description: In this paper, we propose a compact pretrained deep neural network, Transformer Encoder for Social Science (TESS), explicitly designed to tackle text processing tasks in social science research.

item.title: An Empirical Study on the Membership Inference Attack against Tabular Data Synthesis Models
item.description: We conduct experiments on 4 state-of-the-art tabular data synthesis models under two attack scenarios (i. e., one black-box and one white-box attack), and find that the membership inference attack can seriously jeopardize these models.

item.title: DPA-1: Pretraining of Attention-based Deep Potential Model for Molecular Simulation
item.description: Machine learning assisted modeling of the inter-atomic potential energy surface (PES) is revolutionizing the field of molecular simulation.

item.title: Mask and Reason: Pre-Training Knowledge Graph Transformers for Complex Logical Queries
item.description: In this work, we present the Knowledge Graph Transformer (kgTransformer) with masked pre-training and fine-tuning strategies.

item.title: Unsupervised domain adaptation semantic segmentation of high-resolution remote sensing imagery with invariant domain-level context memory
item.description: This study proposes a novel unsupervised domain adaptation semantic segmentation network (MemoryAdaptNet) for the semantic segmentation of HRS imagery.

item.title: Novel algorithm to generate shortest edit script using Levenshtein distance algorithm
item.description: String similarity, longest common subsequence and shortest edit scripts are the triplets of problem that related to each other.

item.title: Signal detection with dynamic programming
item.description: This paper studies the classical problem of detecting the locations of signal occurrences in a one-dimensional noisy measurement.

item.title: Language-guided Semantic Style Transfer of 3D Indoor Scenes
item.description: We address the new problem of language-guided semantic style transfer of 3D indoor scenes.

item.title: CorpusBrain: Pre-train a Generative Retrieval Model for Knowledge-Intensive Language Tasks
item.description: We show that a strong generative retrieval model can be learned with a set of adequately designed pre-training tasks, and be adopted to improve a variety of downstream KILT tasks with further fine-tuning.

item.title: TexPrax: A Messaging Application for Ethical, Real-time Data Collection and Annotation
item.description: We evaluate TexPrax in a user-study with German factory employees who ask their colleagues for solutions on problems that arise during their daily work.

item.title: Counterfactual Supervision-based Information Bottleneck for Out-of-Distribution Generalization
item.description: Along this line, a recent study (Arjovsky et al., 2019) has made a first step and proposes a learning principle of information bottleneck based invariant risk minimization (IB-IRM).

item.title: Object Discovery via Contrastive Learning for Weakly Supervised Object Detection
item.description: Weakly Supervised Object Detection (WSOD) is a task that detects objects in an image using a model trained only on image-level annotations.

item.title: Estimating Appearance Models for Image Segmentation via Tensor Factorization
item.description: Image Segmentation is one of the core tasks in Computer Vision and solving it often depends on modeling the image appearance data via the color distributions of each it its constituent regions.

item.title: Style Your Hair: Latent Optimization for Pose-Invariant Hairstyle Transfer via Local-Style-Aware Hair Alignment
item.description: Editing hairstyle is unique and challenging due to the complexity and delicacy of hairstyle.

item.title: HVS-Inspired Signal Degradation Network for Just Noticeable Difference Estimation
item.description: However, they have a major drawback that the generated JND is assessed in the real-world signal domain instead of in the perceptual domain in the human brain.

item.title: Context-Aware Streaming Perception in Dynamic Environments
item.description: These works evaluate accuracy offline, one image at a time.

item.title: Knowledge-Injected Federated Learning
item.description: Federated learning is an emerging technique for training models from decentralized data sets.

item.title: Uncertainty-guided Source-free Domain Adaptation
item.description: Source-free domain adaptation (SFDA) aims to adapt a classifier to an unlabelled target data set by only using a pre-trained source model.

item.title: DRAGON: Decentralized Fault Tolerance in Edge Federations
item.description: Edge Federation is a new computing paradigm that seamlessly interconnects the resources of multiple edge service providers.

item.title: Training Latent Variable Models with Auto-encoding Variational Bayes: A Tutorial
item.description: Auto-encoding Variational Bayes (AEVB) is a powerful and general algorithm for fitting latent variable models (a promising direction for unsupervised learning), and is well-known for training the Variational Auto-Encoder (VAE).

item.title: Multi-dimensional topological loss for cortical plate segmentation in fetal brain MRI
item.description: Therefore, CP growth and folding patterns are key indicator in the assessment of the brain development and maturation.

item.title: StyleFaceV: Face Video Generation via Decomposing and Recomposing Pretrained StyleGAN3
item.description: Notably, StyleFaceV is capable of generating realistic $1024\times1024$ face videos even without high-resolution training videos.

item.title: ConTextual Mask Auto-Encoder for Dense Passage Retrieval
item.description: Dense passage retrieval aims to retrieve the relevant passages of a query from a large corpus based on dense representations (i. e., vectors) of the query and the passages.

item.title: Machine Learning-Based Test Smell Detection
item.description: Objective: We propose the design and experimentation of a novel test smell detection approach based on machine learning to detect four test smells.

item.title: TRoVE: Transforming Road Scene Datasets into Photorealistic Virtual Environments
item.description: We show that using annotations and visual cues from existing datasets, we can facilitate automated multi-modal data generation, mimicking real scene properties with high-fidelity, along with mechanisms to diversify samples in a physically meaningful way.

item.title: A unifying partially-interpretable framework for neural network-based extreme quantile regression
item.description: In this paper, we propose a new methodological framework for performing extreme quantile regression using artificial neutral networks, which are able to capture complex non-linear relationships and scale well to high-dimensional data.

item.title: LLM.int8(): 8-bit Matrix Multiplication for Transformers at Scale
item.description: We develop a procedure for Int8 matrix multiplication for feed-forward and attention projection layers in transformers, which cut the memory needed for inference by half while retaining full precision performance.

item.title: Pyramidal Predictive Network: A Model for Visual-frame Prediction Based on Predictive Coding Theory
item.description: The main innovation of our model is that the update frequency of neural units on each of the layer decreases with the increasing of network levels, which results in the model appears like a pyramid from the perspective of time dimension, so we call it the Pyramid Predictive Network (PPNet).

item.title: SynKB: Semantic Search for Synthetic Procedures
item.description: In this paper we present SynKB, an open-source, automatically extracted knowledge base of chemical synthesis protocols.

item.title: Efficient Task-Oriented Dialogue Systems with Response Selection as an Auxiliary Task
item.description: The adoption of pre-trained language models in task-oriented dialogue systems has resulted in significant enhancements of their text generation abilities.
